question.reader:
Dear Get Green:

I have two young children, and I’m concerned about the environmental problems our world is facing. Do you have any suggestions for ways that we can help preserve the environment?

Sincerely, Wanna Be Green Dear Wanna Be Green: There are many simple ways to keep our planet healthy. For example. here are some ways to reduce the amount of garbage or trash your family produces:
  • Many communities have recycling programs. If yours doesn’t, do some research. You can probably find a place to take materials to be recycled.
  • If you have a garden, then you probably have “plant trash” like grass clippings and dead leaves. Don’t throw them away. Recycle them! Sprinkle them on your lawn; those things will provide the grass with nutrients and keep it looking great.
  • You can also combine your “plant trash” and fruit and vegetable food scraps from your kitchen to make compost. The plants and food decompose and create a very rich topsoil for your garden.
  • Instead of throwing away items that you no longer use, give them away or sell them. Think of new ways to reuse items that you normally throw away.
  • Take your own bags to the store instead of getting new ones each time you shop.
  • Use e-mail instead of sending paper letters and cards. Pay your bills and read your newspaper online. Call companies that send you junk mail and get off their mailing lists.
  • Buy products made with recycled contents. A lot of things can now be made from recycled materials.
Together we can make a difference!

Sincerely,
Get Green
Information source: www.erie.gov
